title: Would Maria do that?
text:
Yes, Maria Wood.
Welcome to my informal and poorly maintained blog where I, Maria, occasionally write about things I care about including cars and transport, climate, politics, life, etc. Sometimes the takes are hot, sometimes they are exceptionally mild. It’s a temperature roulette in here.
I promise that the aesthetics of this site are in progress. But it’s what’s on the inside that counts, right?
Check out the blog here

title: About
text:
Hi, I’m Maria and I’m a PhD student at CASA UCL in the City Modelling Lab.
I’m studying the social and spatial inequalities in transport, especially in the context of the UK’s EV transition and I have a particular focus on car dependence. I have a particularly strong (negative) feeling towards SUVs in cities. In former lives I played classical flute, got my master’s in physics and worked as an energy consultant in a Big Company. In current and parallel lives I’m a (very) amateur forager, nature enthusiast, vegan, and climate activist. Vom.
